floodArea.riverOrSea: Horner Water, River Aller, Washford River, Hawkcombe Stream, Monksilver Stream, Doniford Stream

items.message: The levels on the Monksilver Stream at Williton,  Horner Water at West Luccombe and the Washford River at Beggearn Huish are rising. Forecasts for these rivers show a likelihood of reaching flood alert level early tomorrow morning, Thursday 13/05/21. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible tomorrow. Areas most at risk are the Horner Water, Rivers Aller and Washford, and the Hawkcombe, Monksilver and Doniford Streams and tributaries.   Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point.  We are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  Visit the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated on Thursday 13/05/21 or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight tonight and into Thursday morning.  
The heavy and persistent rainfall is expected to continue throughout the night and into Thursday morning. Further scattered showers are forecast throughout the day on Thursday.    
We expect river levels to rise overnight with flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. 
River levels will remain high throughout Thursday although no flooding to properties is forecast and warnings are not expected to be issued.

Take care near the areas of concern and check your local weather conditions. 
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Thursday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

items.message:
Flooding is possible overnight tonight and into Thursday morning.

The heavy and persistent rainfall is expected to continue throughout the night and into Thursday morning. Further scattered showers are forecast throughout the day on Thursday.      

We expect river levels to rise overnight with flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river. 

River levels will remain high throughout Thursday although no flooding to properties is forecast and warnings are not expected to be issued.

Take care near the areas of concern and check your local weather conditions. 
We are constantly monitoring river levels and have staff in the area checking for and clearing blockages in this location. This message will be updated on Thursday morning or earlier if the situation changes.

River levels are rising at the Chiselborough, Donyatt and Ashford Mill river gauges as a result of heavy rainfall this evening. Forecasts for these rivers show a likelihood of reaching flood alert level early tomorrow morning, Thursday 13/05/21. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible. Areas most at risk are roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Our incident response staff are checking defences and clearing weed screens.  Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast.  This message will be updated tomorrow, 13/05/21, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Hillfarrance Brook, Halsewater Stream, River Tone

items.message: River levels are rising at the Bishops Hull river gauge.  The forecast shows a likelihood of reaching the flood alert threshold in the early hours of tomorrow morning, 13/05/21, in response to the heavy rainfall this evening. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible.  There is a risk of flooding to low lying land and roads near Hillfarrance, Bradford on Tone, Lane End Road at Ham and the Creech St Michael to Henlade road. Bradford on Tone ringbanks will be bankfull.   We are closely monitoring the situation.   Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated tomorrow, 13/05/21, or as the situation changes.
